objects.name: ControlsText
objects.string:
WASD - Move
LeftClick - Throw Rock
RightClick - Dash

events.comment: Arranging the Z-order of the pillars and boss so they work with the isometric view. When the player goes above or below their Y position their Z-order changes.
Keeping the player and rock out of the walls
Boss shadow effect layer to make the shadow cast over things below it. Using halg opacity and locking this effect to the shadow position.
Replacing the default arrow key controls with WASD controls, disabling the arrow keys at the beginning of the scene
Displaying that you have the rock - hide/show the held rock when object variable =0/1
Throwing the rock if it's held
If rock hits a wall or boss
To pick the rock back up
When right mouse button is released, we deactivate the top down player controls and add a force to the player object in the direction of the mouse
When the player dashes and its timer runs out, the variable gets set back to 0, we stop the forces on the player, and give them back the top down player controls
Any spawned dash effect sticks to the player
Hide the utility blocks for max/min height
After the rest timer is finished, and depending on the position of the boss is in, an instant force is applied to the boss. (Rising more slowly than it falls)
Resets the has been hit object variable so the boss can be hurt again when they next hit the ground.
When the boss reaches the max height it changes the position variable and resets the rest time so it hangs in the air for 1 second before falling
If the boss's health is 8 or below it'll start using this attack. Creates the tremor hitbox and particle effect and applies a force towards the middle of the player sprite.
If the tremor hits a wall or the boss rises fully, it and its particle effect gets destroyed
If the bosses health is 6 or below, they start to move between the points
When the above conditions are met, and we set "Position" to 2 in order to disable the up and down forced, we select a "Movement" variable between 1-3 to pick a spot to move to.
Depending on the "Movement" variable, the boss with move towards one of the "StompPoints" until it's in range and flips variables to resume slamming attack.
This is to lock the position of the collisions boxes and boss(X-axis) while in motion
If the boss is in "Position" 2(So it is in motion to a new area), and has 4 or less remaining health, it will begin dropping rocks on the player.
If "DropRock" exists, it will fall down with with an instant force.
If the player is in collision with the shadow as the drop rock lands, the player loses 1 health point.
If the "DropRock" goes below the Y position of its shadow both are deleted, a sound is played, and the slam particle effect is applied.
Slam Effect
When the boss reaches the min height it changes the position variable and resets the rest time so it sits on the ground for 1 second before rising
Default position on the character as long as the screen shake timer is beyond 0.2 seconds.
If the camera shake timer gets reset by one of the events in the "Boss Attacking" group, it will react according to the below events and then go back to it's default position on the character.
Once the Boss is in reach, both the player and the boss can hit each other
If the boss is already on the ground the player will be separated from them
If player is under the boss when it hits MinHeight they will take 1 damage
If the rock is under the boss when it stomps it will move it aside
If the rock is in collision with the boss, they'll lose 1 health. And then swap the thrown rock to the floor rock, like in the throwing rock group
The boss only takes damage if they haven't been hit yet during this slam because the "HasBeenHit" variable is toggled to 1 after their first hit.
Being hit by the tremor hurts the player as long as they aren't dashing
Displaying how much health the boss and player have left
If the player is below 3 health, and the boss is below 6, the health pick up spawns at the "HealthPickUpSpot".
When the player runs in to the pick up it gets deleted, then it creates the health particle effect, and increease the player's object variable "Health".
To create the spawn effect, the animation of the heart changes from the spawning default animation to a bouncing resting animation.

objects.name: YouWon
objects.string:
Good Job!

You've Beaten This Example Game.

Click Anywhere To Restart.

objects.name: PoorLuck
objects.string:
Poor Luck.

You Failed To Beat This Example Game's Boss.

Click Anywhere To Restart.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Health (life points and damages for objects)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Add some damage to the object, decreasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit

parameters.description: Value of the damage to do (will be removed from object health)
parameters.name: DamageValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is considered dead (no more health)
eventsFunctions.name: IsDead

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDamaged

eventsFunctions.description: Heal the object, incrasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Heal

parameters.description: How much to heal (will be added to object health)
parameters.name: HealValue

eventsFunctions.description: Change the object health to set it to a specific value (check if the actions to damage or heal the object are not better suited to your use case before using this one).
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealth

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage cooldown (in seconds) (0 for no cooldown)
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageCooldown
